SEARCH
Module FoundationsF25
Package entityClasses

Class Post

java.lang.Object
entityClasses.Post
public final class Post extends Object
Post entity class that manages post creation, retrieval, updates, and deletion. This class provides an interface to the database for post-related operations.

  • Method Details

    • createPost

      public static String createPost(String authorUsername, String titleInput, String bodyInput, String thread)
      Create a new post. 1. Validate title/body text. 2. Insert into DB.
      Parameters:
      authorUsername - logged-in username
      titleInput - raw title from UI
      bodyInput - raw body from UI
      thread - thread category for the post
      Returns:
      "" on success, else error string

    • fetchPosts

      public static List<Map<String,Object>> fetchPosts(boolean mineOnly, String username, boolean includeDeleted, String threadFilter)
      Fetch posts based on filter criteria.
      Parameters:
      mineOnly - whether to fetch only the user's posts
      username - the current user's username
      includeDeleted - whether to include deleted posts
      threadFilter - filter posts by specific thread category
      Returns:
      list of post data as maps

    • fetchPosts

      public static List<Map<String,Object>> fetchPosts(boolean mineOnly, String username, boolean includeDeleted, String threadFilter, String readFilter)
      Fetch posts based on filter criteria with additional read status filtering.
      Parameters:
      mineOnly - whether to fetch only the user's posts
      username - the current user's username
      includeDeleted - whether to include deleted posts
      threadFilter - filter posts by specific thread category
      readFilter - filter posts by read status
      Returns:
      list of post data as maps

    • getPost

      public static Map<String,Object> getPost(int postId)
      Fetch a single post row by id (even if it's soft-deleted).
      Parameters:
      postId - id of the post
      Returns:
      row map or null if not found

    • updatePost

      public static String updatePost(int postId, String newTitleInput, String newBodyInput)
      Update title/body of an existing post. Caller must confirm the user is allowed to edit (owner check). 1. Validate. 2. Update DB.
      Parameters:
      postId - which post
      newTitleInput - new title from UI
      newBodyInput - new body from UI
      Returns:
      "" on success, else validation error

    • deletePost

      public static String deletePost(int postId)
      Soft delete a post. This DOES NOT remove the post row. It sets isDeleted = TRUE in the DB (via softDeletePost). After this: - fetchPosts(..., includeDeleted=false) will hide it from "All posts". - fetchPosts(..., includeDeleted=true) will still return it for "My posts", and the UI can render it as: [Deleted] "title" — "author" - buildThreadView(postId) WILL STILL RETURN THIS POST ROW. The UI can then show: displayTitle = "[Deleted Post]" displayBody = "[This post has been deleted]" and still render all replies. - createReply(...) will reject adding new replies to a deleted post.
      Parameters:
      postId - id of the post to soft-delete
      Returns:
      "" (no validation errors here)

    • createReply

      public static String createReply(int parentPostId, String authorUsername, String replyBodyInput)
      Create a reply under a post. 1. Validate reply text. 2. Confirm parent post exists. 3. Confirm parent post is NOT soft-deleted. 4. Insert reply in DB. This enforces the rule: "Deleted post still shows its old replies, but you can't add NEW replies to it."
      Parameters:
      parentPostId - post being replied to
      authorUsername - current username
      replyBodyInput - raw reply text
      Returns:
      "" on success, else error string

    • fetchRepliesForPost

      public static List<Map<String,Object>> fetchRepliesForPost(int parentPostId)
      Fetch all replies for a given post. NOTE: We ALWAYS return replies, even if the post is soft-deleted. The caller can decide how to display them.
      Parameters:
      parentPostId - which post's replies
      Returns:
      list of reply row maps (possibly empty) Each reply row map is expected to include: id, postId, authorUsername, body, createdAt, updatedAt (access via get*CI helpers to be case-insensitive)

    • getReply

      public static Map<String,Object> getReply(int replyId)
      Get one reply row by id.
      Parameters:
      replyId - which reply
      Returns:
      row map or null if not found

    • updateReply

      public static String updateReply(int replyId, String newReplyBodyInput)
      Update a reply body. Caller must confirm "is this my reply?" first. Steps: 1. Validate new reply body. 2. Update DB. We do NOT care if the parent post is deleted. Editing *existing* text is allowed IF the caller decides it's allowed by policy. If you want to forbid that, do that check in the controller before calling this.
      Parameters:
      replyId - which reply
      newReplyBodyInput - new body text
      Returns:
      "" on success, else validation error

    • deleteReply

      public static String deleteReply(int replyId)
      Delete a reply permanently. Caller enforces ownership/authorization.
      Parameters:
      replyId - which reply to delete
      Returns:
      "" always

    • getStringCI

      public static String getStringCI(Map<String,Object> row, String keyWanted)
      Get a string value from a map using case-insensitive key matching.
      Parameters:
      row - the map containing the data
      keyWanted - the key to search for (case-insensitive)
      Returns:
      the string value or empty string if not found

    • getIntCI

      public static int getIntCI(Map<String,Object> row, String keyWanted)
      Get an integer value from a map using case-insensitive key matching.
      Parameters:
      row - the map containing the data
      keyWanted - the key to search for (case-insensitive)
      Returns:
      the integer value or -1 if not found or not convertible to int

    • getBoolCI

      public static boolean getBoolCI(Map<String,Object> row, String keyWanted)
      Get a boolean value from a map using case-insensitive key matching.
      Parameters:
      row - the map containing the data
      keyWanted - the key to search for (case-insensitive)
      Returns:
      the boolean value or false if not found
